item.title: Book: What Is Life? ★★★☆☆
item.description: For my birthday I got a bunch of books from the oxford landmark science, and this is the second one that I’ve read so far. In the book, the author introduces several of the main properties of life as we know it: Complex: alive entities are really complex Purposeful: living things seem to follow a goal, birds build nests, parents care for their offspring, etc. Dynamic: life is always moving, old cells are dying and new ones get created all the time, it’s a bubbling non-stop.
